# maximumRegionMonitoringDistance

**Instance Property**

The largest boundary distance that can be assigned to a region.

## Declaration

```swift
var maximumRegionMonitoringDistance: CLLocationDistance { get }
```

## Discussion

This property defines the largest boundary distance allowed from a region’s center point. Attempting to monitor a region with a distance larger than this value causes the location manager to send a [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLError-swift.struct/Code/regionMonitoringFailure] error to the delegate.

If region monitoring is unavailable or not supported, the value in this property is `-1`.

## Running the region-monitoring service

- **monitoredRegions**: The set of shared regions monitored by all location-manager objects.
